lexUnit.name: bound.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move by leaping or jumping

sentence.text: The terriers bounded along ahead on their short legs .
In one stride he was bounding smoothly along , a poem of controlled motion ; in the next , his bind legs stiffened and refused to function .
The shapechanger bounded around with excitement .
But as usual all I saw was the hairy form bounding away out of sight round the corner of the house .
Rebecca bounded back like a retriever with a stick .
Large animals , drinking , bounded back into the undergrowth , blinded by our lights .
It did n't want to stay there and came bounding back to her .
Henry knocked for ages but nobody came except a motheaten ginger cat that bounded down from the thirteenth floor and rubbed itself ecstatically against his legs .
They all turned , just in time to see Sergeant bounding down the riverbank .
Louis came bounding down the stairs .
I pushed open the door and bounded in .
At the last moment the hare sensed the danger and bounded off into the undergrowth .
He roared , bounded off and disappeared into the jungle .
A trio of enormous hounds came bounding round the building , causing Cleo to gasp in alarm .
He bounded over to the chest containing the strange white powder .
The two men emerged from the crypt into the daylight , the shorter one leading , bounding up the stone steps as if relieved to be away from the musty chamber .
Seeing them , Richard dug his spurs so hard that his horse bounded forward as if on springs , jerking Philippa against him .
Oliver bounded upstairs , and slowed when he saw the figures on the landing .
The dogs bounded about her , obstreperously wagging their tails .
A flicker of movement to the left caught his eye and abruptly he was braking as a deer bounded across the narrow road .
All these emotions vanished when Richard came bounding towards him with scarlet cheeks and shining eyes , looking happier than the detective had ever seen him .
He could see the dog bounding towards him , its fangs bared , its tail flashing from side to side .
